content: At http://www.fhir.org/guides/argonaut/r2/ValueSet-condition-category.xml.html there's a reference to a code system that is not formally defined. In US-Core, it's been formally defined here:
An implementer is asking whether there's any prospect of changing the existing R2 interfaces to use the US-core code system rather than the argonaut one for which no formal definition is provided.
It was defined in my build when we authored it but looks like it never got published. I'll add an issue. Also there is no link to your "here"...
well, a future version of argonaut would use the US core link I provided, yes?

I don't know the answer because I have always strictly adhered to the same version for the code system and the valueset when defined in FHIR. USCore codesystems start at STU3 - Based on your question - It sounds like that is not a problem...
Here is the original codesystem in the spec. In DSTU2 there was this really sweet way to define the URI so I bunched all the codes into a single codesystem
so it's my fault... a broken link....
